As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience in Rotherham or access to the latest information about sustainable food options in the area. Nevertheless, I can suggest some tips to finding sustainable food options.

1. Look for locally grown and organic produce - choosing locally grown and organic foods can greatly reduce the carbon footprint associated with food transportation and production. There are many farmers' markets and independent shops that offer locally grown and/or organic foods that support the local economy.

2. Reduce meat consumption - livestock production can have a significant impact on the environment. One way to reduce your impact is to reduce meat consumption or choose meats that are raised using sustainable practices, such as grass-fed beef, free-range chicken, and wild-caught fish.

3. Choose foods with eco-friendly certifications - look for products with eco-friendly certifications or labels such as the Marine Stewardship Council (MSC), Fairtrade or Rainforest Alliance that signify that they have been sourced sustainably.

4. Participate in a community-supported agriculture (CSA) program - this program offers a weekly or bi-weekly subscription where you receive locally grown, seasonal produce from nearby farms.

5. Consider packaging - choose food options with minimal packaging or recyclable packaging.

By following these tips, consumers can make more informed and sustainable choices in the food they eat, and contribute to a more sustainable future.
